message: This chest is empty.
This chest is still empty.
No matter how often you look - this chest is empty.
Empty.
Oh! What a surprise!
This time the chest looks even more empty.
Your sighs resound as a loud echo from the empty chest.
How often do you want to check if the chest stays empty?
East Up Down West

replies.text: Now what's that supposed to mean?

message: With a single well-aimed blow, you bring down the rock face. The noise of the collapsing wall is deafening.
This rock face looks kind of wrong.

replies.text: I'll probe for a hidden mechanism.
Maybe I should use my pickaxe?
Maybe I should use my pickaxe?

message: This rock face looks kind of wrong. Shall we take a closer look?

replies.text: Yes. I'll probe for a hidden mechanism.
Maybe I should use my pickaxe?

message: You don't find anything special.
Maybe. Although you would have to work in the dark then, because you can't hold the torch at the same time.

replies.text: Right. Nothing special here for sure.

message: You think: I would have to work in the dark then, because I can't hold the torch at the same time.

replies.text: Right. Nothing special here for sure.

message: Let's better go on and finally find my artifact.
An inexplicable dreadful fear overtakes you.
Hey - these statues are not real! We can just move through them.
These statues are not real, you can just move through them.
These statues always give me a shudder when I pass through them.
You wonder why you have found some rat bones in a library.
Why didn't you take the bones with you?
Oh man, to make matters worse, he's blind.
I should take a closer look at the library.
Wait ...
I got a serious blow. These roundlings were too much. I feel my end coming ...

replies.text: No, I will give you a healing potion!

message:
Too late, I feel my end coming ... Take my artifact ... and use it wisely. Farewell ...
[You get an item]
A long time ago you asked me how to get out of here. Go home, take a nap and you will find out.
Good bye, my friend.
The big yellow cheese now weighs heavily in your bag. Small consolation for the loss of a friend, though.

replies.text: Sigh. Clevred, I will miss you.

message: The artifact was taken back obviously by the roundlings.

replies.text: Sigh. Back into the maze, I fear.

message: [singing] Oh my round, oh my yellow, greatest joy on earth!

replies.text: Do you think the roundlings will chase us anymore?

message: Those cowards? We showed them, so they hid and lick their wounds.
We'll be back in the light of day soon!

replies.text: Finally. My feet went flat. I'm really looking forward to my bed.

message: Your bed? Alright, I'll share it with you.

replies.text: Lucky for you I'm too tired to argue.

message: I got it! I got my artifact! Finally!
Let's hurry back now!
An ancient bone catches your eye.
It seems to be a leg bone of a great old rat. Maybe you could find a better use for it?
You slip the bone unobtrusively into your pocket.
You look at the pile of bones.

replies.text: Put the leg bone back onto the pile.
Maybe you could put another bone from your bag instead?

message: The pile of bones is complete again.
Inconspicuously you search your bag for other bones.

replies.text: Rats, I don't find any similar looking bone.

message: You exchange the ancient bone for the wrong bone and try to look as innocent as possible.
I am really disappointed in you to steal my most precious bone. I'll take it back now.

replies.text: Yikes! You have startled me. Yes, sorry.

message: The rock wall looks quite massive. There is just a tiny little hole in the shape of a bone.

replies.text: What would happen if I put a bone into the hole?

message: The massive rock wall just disappears!
There is a guard somewhere behind this massive gate.
Hey, this massive looking gate has a hole.
This is a rather massive gate.
Look, the door seems to be unlocked.
Wait - the door has no handle on the other side. If we go through, we can't go back.

replies.text: Right. I don't think that there is anything interesting there.

message: I agree. Probably just a shortcut back.
The door seems to be unlocked.
Hmm, the door has no handle on the other side. If I go through, I can't go back.
Looks like there isn't anything interesting there. Probably just a shortcut back.
The cave wall looks very massive here.

replies.text: You search the wall for some weak points or holes.

message: You found a tiny hole.

replies.text: Insert a bone into the hole.
Insert Fraedro's golden key into the hole.
Hit the hole with your pickaxe.
Stuff a fish into the hole.

message: Nothing happens.

replies.text: Insert a bone into the hole.
Insert Fraedro's golden key into the hole.
Hit the hole with your pickaxe.
Stuff a fish into the hole.

message: A fish? Really??
The key easily slipped into the hole and vanished! Suddenly a big rumbling makes you close your eyes.
I hate to admit it, but that was a good idea for once.
Access denied!
Goosebumps crawl up your back.
B o o m!  A loud crack makes you jump.
Whooo is distuuurbing my reeeest?!
Me too. [giggles]
A mad giggle fills the room.
No reply.
Something hisses through the air and hits you hard in the back of the head.
You can't tell what it was. But it hurt.
You should learn to dodge in time, you clumsy two-legged creature.
You grab the content of the gold hunters chest: Some gold nuggets - and a leg bone of a rat!?
Why didn't you take the bones with you?
Oh man, to make matters worse, he's blind.
I should take a closer look back on the isle.
A wooden plank - hmm ...

replies.text: That's exactly what I need! Let's build a bridge ...
It would be a good idea to make a fire now.

message: No it would not.

replies.text: Oh. Well, then let's build the bridge.
But I want a fire right now! It is cold here, and dark.

message: Then you'd have a fire. And then? You would never be able to leave again.

replies.text: I want, want, want! Fire - now!

message: Do you want to stay here forever and starve? Think about the artifact. We have a job to do!

replies.text: Well, then let's just build this stupid bridge. [Grumble]

message: And you will be lonely. Unlike you, I can swim. And I will not spend the end of my life here.

replies.text: All right then. So the wood becomes a bridge instead of giving warmth and joy. Sigh.

message: Farewell then. I will think of you when I have the artifact in my claws!
So that looks sturdy enough to carry a person.
Ouch! Something heavy fell on your head!
Another wooden plank - the ugly ogre from above must have thrown it!

replies.text: Now at last let's build the bridge.

message: No, not this time. You were very lucky that something pursuaded the ogre to do you this favor.

replies.text: Probably you are right, I should not trust my luck too much. Let's build the bridge at last.

message: So that looks sturdy enough to carry a person.
This must be a bad dream.

replies.text: How can I finally wake up?
Maybe I should talk to the rat in my bed again.

message:
You see a note pinned to the door
 * Town hall closed *

replies.text: This is the first time I've ever seen it closed.

message: A bag of freshly baked bread is dangling at the door.

replies.text: Good old Mara - she always knows what I need.

message: No trespassing.
A torch in the bag doesn't make much light.
It might not be a good idea to stumble in the dark.
$playername - I knew you would come back!
Sure, you blockhead. Nice to see you again.

replies.text: I thought you were going to fetch your artifact at last?

message: Yes, yes. But for some jobs you need someone bigger.

replies.text: OK, let us try again to find it.
So, am I good enough for the dirty work? Forget it. Bye.

message: Great - then let's go!
Go and look for a torch, you blockhead! And use it!
It might not be a good idea to stumble in the dark.
The fence would be no problem for you.
Thief! This is our food!!
Do not enter the enclosure!
The sign is no longer readable.
Hey! Don't take any cheese into the museum! I don't want greasy fingerprints all over the valuable objects!

replies.text: How do you know that I have some in my bag?
Now calm down. Can I deposit my cheese here somewhere?
I don't go anywhere without my cheese.

message: Then you can't enter.

replies.text: So what can I do now?
I'm not interested in your dusty stuff anyway.

message: Of course he smells it, you poor two-leg with your pathetic nose.

replies.text: Oh. What can I do now?

message: You can give me the cheese, I'll take good care of it. Or you can just put it here on the floor.

replies.text: Good. Here please take my cheese. But don't eat it.
I'll just put it down here.
Maybe I should just eat everything at once here and now.

message: Now you may follow me into our memory hall.
It is beautiful inside here, isn't it?

replies.text: Hmm, I'd prefer a bit more daylight.

message: The paths are so logical, it's easy to find your way around here.

replies.text: Do you think so? I am rather lost already.
Is it? Then tell me how to get out.

message: Two-legs are really dumb. We rats always know where to go.

replies.text: For example, how would I get back to Crossglen?

message: If you want to get out, just follow the rats. They show you the way.
Don't tell me that you didn't recognize it? That my fellow rats are always running towards the exit?

replies.text: Now that you mention it, indeed they do!

message: If you want to get out, just use the passages that you see rats in front of.
Oh man. Humans are not the smartest beings, but this one ...
Ah, I love these tunnels!

replies.text: Me, I loath these tunnels by now.
Clevred, let me ask you a question.

message: What I always wanted to ask you: why did you actually kill my uncle?
Yes. My uncle together with his wife. They just romped around in your garden.
Then you came and murdered them. Just because. And you proudly boasted in front of your father about this act.
Not that I liked my uncle, but he didn't deserve such an end.
Neither my aunt. She was always squeeking too loud by far. But they were decent rats.
I hope you are a little more reluctant to kill rats in the future.

replies.text: Clevred, let me ask you a question.

message: Why don't you wear that necklace you've got? The blue one that would show you the way to the sky?

replies.text: No need. I know the way perfectly well.
Well, why don't I? Really, I forgot about it.
I understood how the blue necklace works. Don't bother me with that anymore.

message: It's okay. If you still want to hear it again, just ask me.
That's simple enough even for a simple mind: If worn they will mark the passage towards the mountain top with a blue shield.
Why don't you wear that orange necklace you've got?

replies.text: No need. I know the way perfectly well.
Well, why don't I? Really, I forgot about it.
I understood how the orange necklace works. Don't bother me with that anymore.

message: It's okay. If you still want to hear it again, just ask me.
That's simple enough even for a simple mind: If worn it will mark the passage towards the most interesting places here in the caves.
You should not forget important things. The necklace works simple enough even for you: If worn it will mark the passage towards the most interesting places here in the caves.
The way might be somewhat longer, but you won't miss anything important of the cave's wonders.
Should there be a branch, there will be an additional flag. The side trip is marked with a yellow shield.
Sigh. If you see an orange shield together with a flag, then first look for another passage marked with a yellow shield.
Follow this passage to the end. We might find something important there. Then go back to the crossing and follow the orange shield again.
[muttering] I want to hope so, but I don't really believe it yet.
[humming] Roads go ever on and on, over rock and under tree,
By caves where never sun has shone, by streams that never find the sea.
Pursuing it with eager feet, until the proper way is found
towards the yellow artifact, so wonderful and big and round.

replies.text: Clevred, let me ask you a question.

message: Are we there soon?

replies.text: Clevred, let me ask you a question.

message: Is it still far?

replies.text: Clevred, let me ask you a question.

message: Boring. We might play a game?

replies.text: Why not? What about 'Rock Paper Scissors'?

message: OK. I begin. Ready - Set - GO!
Paper - I'll wrap your rock!

replies.text: Clevred, let me ask you a question.

message: Scissors - oh dear.
Rock - too.
Scissors - I'll cut your paper!

replies.text: Clevred, let me ask you a question.

message: Rock - oh dear, you'll wrap my rock.
Paper - too.
Rock - let's smash your scissors!

replies.text: Clevred, let me ask you a question.

message: Paper - oh dear, you'll cut my paper.
Scissors - too.
King!
The king always wins of course.

replies.text: Cheater! I don't play with you anymore!
Clevred, let me ask you a question.

message: You really look funny as you stumble around on your two legs that are way too long.

replies.text: What? Take a look at yourself: Crooked four legs, much too short to even hold a knife.
Clevred, let me ask you a question.

message: You can run much faster on four legs. Give it a try!
You are so quiet. Say, what's your problem.
You can trust me. You will see, it will do you good.

replies.text: I really don't have a problem. At least not until now.

message: Ah, I knew it. What is it then?
Your problem that you just wanted to talk about.

replies.text: I don't want to talk about my problems.

message: So several problems. Which one do you want to start with?
At least it's a problem that you keep contradicting yourself.

replies.text: Oh rat, you're annoying. You are my problem.

message: See now? Your problem is your negative attitude.

replies.text: I wonder which tastes better, fried, boiled or grilled rat?

message: You have bad taste.
Oh, don't look so murderous at me. You brutal biped.
Don't worry, I am still by your side.

replies.text: Clevred, let me ask you a question.

message: What do you think it will look like?
The artifact, of course. Will it be big and round and shiny like I was always told?

replies.text: And will it be worth our labor to find it?

message: Labor?! This is a fun tour!

replies.text: Clevred, let me ask you a question.

message: Hey, you know what?

replies.text: Oh great, why can't you be silent for a minute at least?

message: Phh. You are so mean. I won't talk to you anymore.

replies.text: Clevred, let me ask you a question.

message:
There was a young rat of Prim,
Who was so uncommonly thin

That when it tried
To drink lemonade
It slipped through the straw and fell in.

replies.text: Hahaha - that is a good one.
Clevred, let me ask you a question.

message: Sure - what do you want to know?

replies.text: Why do you seem to know everything?
Was this huge cave behind our supply cave the whole time? I had never seen it before.
How does the orange amulet work, in detail?
What will you do with the artifact if we gain it?
How does the blue amulet work, in detail?
Why do you hunt for the artifact?
How do I get back out of this cave?

message: I think that's the only thing I do not know.
Oh, that's easy. I will become famous - even more than King Rah himself!
Because it's there, of course.
Who knows? And even if - in every dream there is a grain of truth.
I'd better bite your toe hard one more time. Maybe then you will know?

replies.text: Eh ... no, it's not that important.

message: Of course. After all, you two-legged folk shouldn't find our realm too easily.
I remember your brother was sometimes up here with one or two other human beings.
A beautiful view.
Do you need much longer?
Hey, wake up!
An empty plate.
You hear a voice: "Eat me!"

replies.text: Oh that cake looks tasty. Let's try it.

message: You gulp the cake down and wait.
Nothing obvious happens.
You feel a pleasant warmth flowing through your body.
You feel strange and suddenly icy cold.
An beautiful bottle - unfortunately empty.
You hear a voice: "Drink me!"

replies.text: What a lovely color of the bottle. Let's try it.

message: You swallow it down and wait.
Nothing obvious happens.
You feel a pleasant warmth flowing through your body.
You feel dizzy and suddenly start to sweat heavily.
Wait! Do you feel it too? We are very close!
Of course.
I am so excited!
Over there - look, the roundling!
I am not so sure. Roundlings are a strange folk.
Why doesn't he ever do what he's told?

replies.text: Hey, come in! It is cool and refreshing.

message: Wait! I know this place - it is Flora's fountain. This could be a trap!

replies.text: Do you think? It looks so peaceful.
Maybe you are right. We better leave.

message: Yeah. Let's better not go under the blue swirl.
Visitors not wanted
Here you can see the complete skeleton of King Rah.

replies.text: Such a great sight! Wart has done a great job.

message: This is the crown of the old Kingdom.
This is the great key.
No rat knows where it fits.
This is King Rah's diary.
At least that is the prevailing opinion. It is written in secret script.
A suit of armor several centuries old, with the Rat Empire emblem.
Wonderfully decorated chests - unfortunately all locked.
Many shelves loaded with thick books.
A great axe from the last century. You don't want to face a warrior with this weapon in his hands.
The table is empty. The displayed item seems to be missing.
King Rah's mighty sword.
Oh, you bring the mighty sword of King Rah! That's great, we will keep it in honor.

replies.text: No, I decided to keep it.

message: Look how nice it looks on the table over there.
This is a lot of money for our museum. But here you have 1000 gold.
You are crazy. Our museum doesn't have such a big amount of gold.
Oh, you have found the mighty sword of King Rah! That's great.
You may as well give the sword to us now, or you won't get through here.

replies.text: So I have no choice. Here you are.
I'd rather starve here than give you the sword.

message: Dish of the day: Filet de serpent sur pommes de terre au chou rouge.
You see a beautifully crafted statue of your brother Andor.
Andor's statue may be cleared away with a pickaxe. Hadn't I mentioned it?
When will you finally try to use the pickaxe?
What a nice sword. Too bad it's stuck firmly in the wall.
What a nice sword. Too bad it's stuck firmly in the wall.
The sword is gone! There is just an illusion left.
The sword is gone! There is just an illusion left.
King Rah's sword! Quick - say the words!
King Rah's sword! Now what again were the words to say?
Yes, yes! It moves ...

'Hall of remembrance and commemoration of the glorious history of ratdom

Free entry - donation requested'

replies.text: Great, I might get a clue how to find my way through these twisty little passages.

message:
Oh, there is a note attached to it:

'Museum closed until further notice due to vandalism.
Ring the bell for further advice.'

replies.text: OK, they had their chance. Let's leave.

message: DING!
You can't get through.
Hey! You must not go there!
As soon as you stepped on the carpet, a loud voice boomed: STOP THE THIEF!
Leave the carpet immediatly!

replies.text: Sure. But I'll take this bone here with me.

message: You picked the bone from its pedestal. Immediatly the music stopped. Uh oh ...
Hey, why did you disturb our Bone Dance?
Hey, come and join the Bone Dance!
Yeah?
Yeah, yeah, yeah!
What now?
Oom chicky oom chick, oom chicky oom chi-chicky
What next?
Come on Andor, let's have fun there!
... what? Eh, no. Just a song we heard once.
Do not disturb me. I have to concentrate, because I am providing the light.
You stopped short under the stare of the skeleton leader.
Do you really want to open this ominous looking massive door? It looks dangerous.
This ominous looking massive door looks dangerous.
It must be extremely dangerous, because it is secured with two strong doors.
It must be extremely dangerous, because it is secured with two strong doors.
Also I don't believe that the artifact is behind this door.

replies.text: OK. Let's go back and seek your artifact.
No, Clevred. We are going inside.

message: Yeah. Wise decision.
He never listens to me, does he?

The last words of the young ogre are echoing through the cave:
'Help! Help! This sneaky dwarf kills us ...'

Then - silence.

Suddenly the cave is filled with the sound of stomping feet.
Ogres - they are everywhere!
Beware of the ogre!
What an ugly monster!
Roar?

replies.text: Fortunately for you there is no mirror here.
Sorry, I didn't want to disturb you.

message: ROAR!!

replies.text: Aww, is the little brute angry now?
Oops, I better be quiet now ...

message: Indeed you better be!

replies.text: The beast is able to talk?

message: It is ENOUGH now! I'll teach you manners!

You were so tired yesterday, that you didn't even make it to your bed. You dreamed of rats and that something bit your toes firmly. Apparently you had a nightmare.
You open your eyes ...
... but you seem to sleep still!
Hey! Have you already done all my tasks?
You stumbled to the ground.

You didn't make it to your bed - again. Nevertheless you took some minutes of sleep.
When you woke up, something had changed. The rats are gone!

What a terrible dream. Or - was everything really just a dream?
$playername - do I have to worry about you?
You got rid of the rats long ago.

replies.text: No. Yes, but ...  Have you seen Clevred?

message: I don't know anyone with that name. You must have had a bad dream. And better stay off the mead.
Yes that's what they all say. Better go and find Andor at last.
When I think of drinking - Mara seems to have disappeared. So we're all going to stop drinking mead.
Maybe she wanted to make her dream of opening a tavern in Brightport come true?
Tharal has also disappeared. But I don't think that has anything to do with each other. He often just roams through the forest and will definitely be back soon.

replies.text: I hope so. But I have a bad feeling ...

message: By the way - Tharal seems to have disappeared. So he won't be able to cure your headache.
Maybe he needed some time of peace and roams through the forest?
I hope he will be back soon.

replies.text: I hope so too. But I have a bad feeling ...

message: Go around the flag.
One time around the flag is enough.
[unreadable signs]
Scribble? It is plain text!
It says: 'Don't touch the water.'
You find some rat bones on the ground behind the flag.
A deep well

replies.text: You throw a shimmering globe into the well.

message: A deep well

replies.text: You throw a shimmering globe into the well.

message: A deep well

replies.text: You throw a shimmering globe into the well.

message: A deep well

replies.text: You throw a shimmering globe into the well.

message: No, no, no, NO!
Not orange! Make it blue!
Blue! Do you hear me? BLUE!!
Is it really that difficult? Sigh.
You have found 5 shimmering balls.

replies.text: It seems to be more difficult than I thought at first.
Oh my. I just don't know how to solve this.

message: Clevred certainly would have known what to do now.

replies.text: Why only did I leave him?

message: Sigh. Need help again?

replies.text: Don't pretend you know how to solve it.
Please. I just don't know what to do here.

message: I don't pretend to know. I do know.
Simply drop the balls into the right wells, so that the lamps all have one color. So easy.

replies.text: But the lamps never do what I want. Stupid game.

message: Don't start crying.
Each well seem to affect the lamps in a certain way. Just combine that - I am sure you get it now.

replies.text: Do you think so? OK. I'll try again.

message: Oh dear. What do you have a head for, just against the rain? Well I could do it for you.

replies.text: Please do. Here, take the balls.

message: Ready. I hope you watched closely how I did it.
Let's do the bone dance again!
Me and water? Forget it!
